ratings.comment: Poor professor. Don't take her class unless you have to!

Her PowerPoints are a million slides and she moved too quickly through them. She asks for feedback on her teaching, but then does not change anything about her lectures. She knows a lot about statistics, but does not know how to actually teach a class. Do not take a class if you do not have to.

Doesn't give a lot of direction when it comes to in class activities. When asking a question she will not give you feedback that is useful. Students have called her out during lectures and she blames students on their poor work. Not good at public speaking. Very confusing and makes you feel dumb.

Consumer Research. Addo was not most effective in providing direction for the stats heavy material. Grading was inconsistent and she seemed condescending at moments. Scope of assignments and case studies were vague. Poor speaker, learned more from working with classmates. Passionate about material, but not great at communicating at lower level.

Professor stands in the same spot and lectures the whole class. Not very clear and definitely not an engaging class. I have a hard time learning strictly from lecture slides so this wasn't an easy class. Honestly, I still don't understand the key concepts from this class or what I was suppose to get out of this class.
